alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 6:33PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW... At 632 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Fort Hall Bannock Peak to 15 miles south of Rockland to 8 miles southeast of Oakley Reservoir. Movement was east at 65 mph. Locations impacted include... Soda Springs, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Grace, Downey, Georgetown, Arimo, Holbrook Summit, Thatcher, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Almo, Virginia, Juniper, Clifton, Oxford, Georgetown Summit, Diamond Creek Campground and City Of Rocks. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this band of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this band of heavy snow. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
